member.name: DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_TARGET_INFO
member.summary: The DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_TARGET_INFO structure contains target information for a single path.

member.name: DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_TARGET_INFO.adapterId
member.summary: The identifier of the adapter that the path is on.

member.name: DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_TARGET_INFO.id
member.summary: The target identifier on the specified adapter that this path relates to.

member.name: DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_TARGET_INFO.DUMMYUNIONNAME.modeInfoIdx
member.summary: A valid index into the mode information table that contains the target mode information for this path only when DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_SUPPORT_VIRTUAL_MODE is not set. If target mode information is not available, the value of modeInfoIdx is DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_MODE_IDX_INVALID.

member.name: DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_TARGET_INFO.DUMMYUNIONNAME.DUMMYSTRUCTNAME.desktopModeInfoIdx
member.summary: A valid index into the mode array of the entry that contains the desktop mode information for this path only when DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_SUPPORT_VIRTUAL_MODE is set. If there is no entry for this in the mode array, the value of desktopModeInfoIdx is DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_DESKTOP_IMAGE_IDX_INVALID. Supported starting in Windows 10.

member.name: DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_TARGET_INFO.DUMMYUNIONNAME.DUMMYSTRUCTNAME.targetModeInfoIdx
member.summary: A valid index into the mode array of the entry that contains the target mode information for this path only when DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_SUPPORT_VIRTUAL_MODE is set. If there is no entry for this in the mode array, the value of targetModeInfoIdx is DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_TARGET_MODE_IDX_INVALID. Supported starting in Windows 10.

member.name: DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_TARGET_INFO.outputTechnology
member.summary: The target's connector type. For a list of possible values, see the enumerated type.

member.name: DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_TARGET_INFO.rotation
member.summary: A value that specifies the rotation of the target. For a list of possible values, see the enumerated type.

member.name: DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_TARGET_INFO.scaling
member.summary: A value that specifies how the source image is scaled to the target. For a list of possible values, see the enumerated type. For more information about scaling, see Scaling the Desktop Image.

member.name: DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_TARGET_INFO.refreshRate
member.summary: A structure that specifies the refresh rate of the target. If the caller specifies target mode information, the operating system will instead use the refresh rate that is stored in the vSyncFreq member of the structure. In this case, the caller specifies this value in the targetVideoSignalInfo member of the structure. A refresh rate with both the numerator and denominator set to zero indicates that the caller does not specify a refresh rate and the operating system should use the most optimal refresh rate available. For this case, in a call to the function, the caller must set the scanLineOrdering member to the DISPLAYCONFIG_SCANLINE_ORDERING_UNSPECIFIED value; otherwise, SetDisplayConfig fails.

member.name: DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_TARGET_INFO.scanLineOrdering
member.summary: A value that specifies the scan-line ordering of the output on the target. For a list of possible values, see the enumerated type. If the caller specifies target mode information, the operating system will instead use the scan-line ordering that is stored in the scanLineOrdering member of the structure. In this case, the caller specifies this value in the targetVideoSignalInfo member of the structure.

summary.para: A Boolean value that specifies whether the target is available. TRUE indicates that the target is available.

Because the asynchronous nature of display topology changes when a monitor is removed, a path might still be marked as active even though the monitor has been removed. In such a case, targetAvailable could be FALSE for an active path. This is typically a transient situation that will change after the operating system takes action on the monitor removal.
A bitwise OR of flag values that indicates the status of the target. The following values are supported:

listheader.description: Target is in use on an active path.
The output can be forced on this target even if a monitor is not detected.
Output is currently being forced in a boot-persistent manner.
Output is currently being forced in a path-persistent manner.
Output is currently being forced in a nonpersistent manner.

The output is a head-mounted display (HMD). Such a path is only returned from QueryDisplayConfig using the QDC_INCLUDE_HMD flag.
Supported starting in the Windows 10 Creators Update (Version 1703).
